definition: to push open (a gate etc)/to push away/to reject/to decline
to push/to cut/to refuse/to reject/to decline/to shirk (responsibility)/to put off/to delay/to push forward/to nominate/to elect/massage

to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format

sentences.english: Phoenix beauty a pushed away flow rock.
sentences.chinese: 鳳人美一把推開了流巖。

sentences.english: For major reforms, we will first experiment with projects and gradually expand to other areas only after gaining useful experience.
sentences.chinese: 重大改革措施堅持先行試點，取得經驗後再逐步推開。

sentences.english: Continue to deepen reform of rural collective forest right system reform in full.
sentences.chinese: 農村綜合改革繼續深化，集體林權制度改革全面推開。

sentences.english: I opened the windows. The wind out there was strong, but doesn't blow into my room, not a little.
sentences.chinese: 我推開窗口，外面風很大，卻一絲都沒吹進房裏。

sentences.english: The front door of the office flew open. In burst a young man with a gun.
sentences.chinese: 店門突然推開，衝了進來的是個少年郎，手中握着槍。

sentences.english: When the door opens, push with your foot.
sentences.chinese: 鎖開了之後，再用你的腳把門推開。

sentences.english: He tries pushing against the chest of drawers.
sentences.chinese: 他試圖推開五斗櫃卻沒推動。

sentences.english: Eventually he pushed her off, and she stumbled towards the winepress.
sentences.chinese: 最後，他把她推開，她一個趔趄，倒向了那臺榨酒機。

sentences.english: The window is stick. He opened it with one push.
sentences.chinese: 窗戶貼住了，他用力一推把它推開了。

sentences.english: " Or "you are afraid of being robbed, so you push him away, don't you?
sentences.chinese: 或“你害怕別人來搶，所以才推開他，是嗎？”

sentences.english: Maybe she would be crying and would push him away when he tried to explain to her.
sentences.chinese: 她也許還會哭着一把將他推開，不容他分辯。

sentences.english: Shoved open the window, the moon has hung nearby day error, good beautiful, was so intoxicant.
sentences.chinese: 推開了窗，月亮掛在天闕邊，好美，是如此得醉人。

sentences.english: Tom pushed his way to the gate of the club by sweeping others aside.
sentences.chinese: 湯姆推開旁人，擠到了俱樂部的門口。

sentences.english: Bang floor is a , the gate of sickroom is shoved away.
sentences.chinese: 砰地一聲，病房的門驟然被推開。

sentences.english: With a yell, Roger threw open the screen door, tore through the kitchen and scrambled up the stairs.
sentences.chinese: 羅傑一聲歡呼，猛然推開紗門，衝過廚房，奔上樓梯。

sentences.english: In a tremble they opened the street door.
sentences.chinese: 他們顫抖着推開了街門。

definition: to close (a door)/to turn off (light, electrical equipment etc)
(of a person) to turn round/to face about/(of a widow) to remarry (archaic)
to enter a door/to go in/to learn the basics of a subject/to join one's husband's household upon marriage
to open a door (lit. and fig.)/to open for business
car door/door of bus, railway carriage etc
to open one's mouth/to start to talk
to interrupt/to break off/to break (a bone)
